bestBHT.bht: The language used in this vivid description should not solely be understood as referring to the final day, but rather as a portrayal of fear and awe that will grip men's hearts. The falling of the stars from the heavens, as depicted graphically in the original language, serves as a reminder of the profound impact of this event. While some may interpret it symbolically, it is crucial to grasp the magnitude of what is being conveyed.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: And the stars of heaven shall fall... the sea and the waves roaring; men's hearts failing them for fear."
Though the grandeur of this language carries the mind over the head of all periods but that of Christ's Second Coming..."
We cannot therefore consider the mere strength of this language a proof that it refers exclusively or primarily to the precursors of the final day...
Marvin Vincent: The stars of heaven shall fall.

The stars shall be falling from heaven.
Archibald T. Robertson: The stars shall be falling (ο αστερες εσοντα πιπτοντες). Periphrastic future indicative, εσοντα, future middle indicative and πιπτοντες, present active participle.
John Gill: The Jewish Rabbins and doctors, who fell off from the written word, and compiled their 'Misna', or oral law, their book of traditions, and set it up above the Bible...

bhtAttempts.bht: When considering the verse, it is important to acknowledge the grandeur of the language used, though it may not exclusively refer to the final day. The stars of heaven falling from the sky is a graphic depiction, portrayed even more vividly in the original language. This rendering serves as a reminder of the fear and awe that will stir the hearts of men during this time. While some may interpret this verse in a more symbolic manner, it is crucial to focus on the overall message of the passage.
